fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27388].
  {panel}

It seems that this page https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Theme+Module (and its child pages) needs some loves for an update or revamp. A user reported that this is no longer working in Confluence 4.3.x.

Particularly, the sample of the plugins provided in the page isn't working well with Confluence 4.3.x as per my own tests:
- Left Nav Theme https://developer.atlassian.com/download/attachments/2031725/themes-leftnavigation.jar?version=1&modificationDate=1122527653413
-- This seems to be a known issue as we have deprecated Left Nav Theme quite long time ago. So it's kinda expected to not work well with Confluence 4.3.x. It'd be nice to get these information updated so one would know and not get confused when things appear to be broken all over the place.
- Easy Blue Theme - https://developer.atlassian.com/download/attachments/2031799/easy-blue-theme-1.1.jar?version=1&modificationDate=1227483442846 from this page https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Creating+a+Stylesheet+Theme
-- Footer is missing and some styling isn't applied well. I think this is another compatibility issue as the docs and plugins were written quite long time ago, and there's been so much changes in recent Confluence interface/styling/themes since then.

Maybe we can revisit these docs and ensure it will work with recent Confluence releases. Or at very least, state the highest version of Confluence that the docs can be applied to.
fields.summary: Confluence Theme development documentation and plugin samples seem to be no longer compatible with recent Confluence releases
macro autocomplete doesn't support scandinavian characters

  {panel}

h3.Steps to reproduce:
*In a IE9*

# Create a page, select any of the {{Page Layout}} options.
# Insert an image.
# You'll see that you won't be able to edit _(resize,add effects)_


h3. Workaround:

Use Firefox or Chrome.
fields.summary: Unable to edit images inside of a page layout in IE9

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27385].
  {panel}

I have been looking for a way to send attachments from confluence pages directly from confluence, instead of having to save the attachment locally and then attach them in a mail in e.g. outlook.
The SSLPost plugin seemed to do exactly what I needed, except for all the encryption administration.
In that plugin, you get a button on the page 'SSLPost', which makes a pop-up appear, in which you can fill in the email address to which the mail needs to be sent, select to only send the attachements, and  can select/deselect the attachments to be sent/not to be sent. 
The only downside on that plugin is that there is a lot of administration needed to have the email encrypted, and then sent to the right domain and stuff. Too much hassle, email can be sent in plain open text format.
fields.summary: email pages and/or attachments to external email addresses
Include Rapid Board macro in Confluence

fields.summary: Image in PDF layout doesn't work in Confluence 4.3

fields.description:
Edit a page in Confluence, where the page contains a table that has multiple rows and with cells that have background colors.

When you click Edit, the cells reset to the default 'white' background. Click preview to confirm that the colours won't show up on the new version of the page.

fields.description:
The 'white' colour in the "select colour" dropdown for cell highlighting doesn't actually mean "make this white". Rather, it means "turn off highlighting". In a normal cell, this is the same as making it white, but in a header row it returns the cell to the standard grey. This can be confusing.

We need to add a new icon. For example, it could show a white square with red line through it.
fields.summary: Add a new icon for disabling cell highlight - not white

fields.description:

If they're just clicked in a single cell it works fine.

fields.description:
To reproduce:
* have a table with 1 row: a header
* use toolbar (or a keyboard shortcut) to insert a new row below
* notice it is header row again -- expected a normal row
* try changing it by selecting the full row and using the toolbar button - doesn't work
* using highlight row button does not work as expected either.
fields.summary: Cannot change a table row from header to normal
Allow Pages to be Excluded from Page Tree Search

fields.description:
If you insert a viewdoc macro using the wiki markup shortcut, that is typing {noformat}{viewdoc:filename.doc}{noformat} the wiki markup code differs from the one generated by adding the same macro from the macro browser:

| Using wiki markup | {code}<ac:macro ac:name="viewdoc"><ac:default-parameter>test.doc</ac:default-parameter></ac:macro>{code} |
| Using macro browser | {code}<ac:macro ac:name="viewdoc"><ac:parameter ac:name="name">test.doc</ac:parameter></ac:macro>{code} |

As a consequence, macros added using wiki markup shortcuts cannot be edited.

This is also affecting content migrated from previous versions using wiki markup.

+Workaround:+
You can add the macro using the following string instead:
{noformat}{viewdoc:name=filename.doc}{noformat}

In Oracle database this can be changed in DB with the following query:
(!) This will modify your database. Please take a backup or your instance before applying these changes.
{code:sql}
UPDATE bodycontent 
SET body = REGEXP_REPLACE(body, '<ac:macro ac:name="viewfile"><ac:default-parameter>(.+)</ac:default-parameter></ac:macro>', '<ac:macro ac:name="viewfile"><ac:parameter ac:name="name">\1</ac:parameter></ac:macro>')
WHERE contentid IN (
SELECT contentid FROM content WHERE prevver IS NULL AND contenttype IN ('PAGE','BLOGSPOT') AND content_status='current');
{code}
You will need to change the text {{viewfile}} by the name of the macro you want to migrate ({{viewdoc}}, {{viewxls}},...).
fields.summary: Adding viewfile, viewdoc,... macros using wiki markup does not generate the right XHTML

Is _it_ some sort of reserved word which cannot be used in a label?

An anchor that linked to some content in Expand macro should expand the content automatically instead of expanding it manually.

# Create a new page and [add a link to the anchor|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Working+with+Anchors#WorkingwithAnchors-Creatingalinktoananchor].

!anchor.jpg|thumbnail!

!link_to_anchor.jpg|thumbnail!

!result.jpg|thumbnail!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27350].
  {panel}

The ROTP team work will allow customers to add their own app links to Confluence OD.

They have found that when Confluence OD Standalone is applinked to a JIRA instance using OAuth, the Insert JIRA Issue feature is not enabled.

It is enabled for OD a-la-carte instances, and it works for OAuth on BTF instances.

It should work for any arbitrary applink to a JIRA instance.

Enabled dark features: confluence.new-header

fields.description:
It seems there is race condition somewhere in the notification mechanism in Confluence.
I cannot really re-produce this 100% but it happens from time to time on our Confluence site.
It seems that it happens when two different users are editing two different pages and save it at the same time.

Then Confluence sends an email with a Subject from Page edited by userA, but with the contents (changes) of the Page edited by userB.
I can see this behavior to be space independent ( I just received an email with the subject from the page I was editing in one space and with the contents of totally other page from another space ).

I guess this can be classified as a potential security issue as I can get a notification from a page I should not see.

Please let me know if you need any further details to investigate.

This is not a new issue (i.e. not in 4.3 release) - I was seeing it before, just thought it is high time to report it :-)
fields.summary: Confluence mixes notfication emails
Support SOAP API for WorkBox

fields.description:
Hello colleagues!
We're testing Confluence 4.3.2 and experiencing problems with the Universal Plugin Manager. It reports, that it can now be updated, but update stops and error message appears:
"There was an unexpected error. For further information please refer to the protocols.".
Logs contain no reports about any errors and everything seems to be OK.
The UPM v. 2.0.6 is installed and activated.

Has anybody observed errors like this?
fields.summary: Cannot update Universal Plugin Manager. No errors in logs!

fields.description:
This error message is shown if either the JIRA server is unavailable or the Confluence URL is incorrect. 'localhost' is used in the steps to reproduce below, but if your Confluence instance can be accessed using 'localhost' you can easily reproduce the issue by changing it to something invalid.

We should look at providing more specific error messages, and whether it's possible to automate the removal of the incorrect application link in JIRA as soon as it's created.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install the latest version of Confluence (tested on 4.3.2)
# Install JIRA 4.3 or above
# During setup of Confluence, select to manage users in JIRA
# In the JIRA directory configuration screen, enter JIRA URL and username correctly
# Leave Confluence URL pointing to localhost, and attempt to connect
# You will see the error "This is not a valid url for JIRA 4.3 or later"
# Change the URL to be correct, and retry
# You will still see the error

h3. Workaround
You need to remove the Application Link that is created in JIRA, through Application Links in JIRA Admin. Then try again with the correct URL.
fields.summary: Getting "This is not a valid url for JIRA 4.3 or later" when trying to connect to JIRA for User Management during Confluence Installation.

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence 4.3.3
# Run through the setup wizard and select JIRA for User Management
# Enter your JIRA server credentials
# The page will not move forward, the next button is greyed out, and you will see this error in the logs:
{code}
2012-11-23 16:06:17,232 ERROR [Long running task: Synchronising JIRA Directory] [confluence.setup.actions.ConnectToJiraSyncDirectoryAction$SyncJiraDirectoryLongRunningTask] doInTransactionWithoutResult User <admin> does not exist
 -- referer: http://localhost:10433/setup/connecttojirasyncdirectory-start.action | url: /setup/connecttojirasyncdirectory-start.action | userName: anonymous | action: connecttojirasyncdirectory-start
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.UserNotFoundException: User <admin> does not exist
{code}
where <admin> is the admin user in JIRA, and does exist.

See the attached log for the full stack trace and errors.

NB: A similar error occurred in Confluence 4.3.2, but the error in the logs is this:
{code}
2012-11-23 16:26:32,309 ERROR [http-10432-1] [atlassian.confluence.servlet.ConfluenceServletDispatcher] sendError Could not execute action
 -- referer: http://localhost:10432/setup/connecttojira-start.action | url: /setup/connecttojirasyncdirectory-start.action | userName: anonymous
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.actions.ConnectToJiraSyncDirectoryAction.getInternalDirectoryId(ConnectToJiraSyncDirectoryAction.java:81)
{code}

Sometimes there is no error, but the page hangs at 
!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/80395/jirausermgmt.png!


The last line in the logs is:
{code}
2012-11-23 17:33:57,401 INFO [Long running task: Synchronising JIRA Directory] [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations] findGroupsToUpdate scanned and compared [ 42 ] groups for update in DB cache in [ 6ms ]
{code}
Again see the attached 4.3.2 log for full error and stack trace.


h3. Workaround
# Clean the Confluence install by backing up and removing the contents of <confluence-home>, and backing up the database.
# Run the installation again 
# Select to Continue and Overwrite Existing Data in the database, and continue
# Instead of choosing JIRA for User Management, select to Manage Users and Groups Within Confluence
# Create an admin account
# Once you are into Confluence, set up JIRA as a User Directory by following [these instructions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Connecting+to+Crowd+or+JIRA+for+User+Management]
fields.summary: Cannot use JIRA for User Management during Installation - process hangs and will not continue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27337].
  {panel}

Customers are reporting that they were previously able to display password-protected Vimeo videos via the widget connector, but that this no longer works.

See the following comments on the doc pages:

*Comment 1:*
From: [Rich Schone|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/~rich.schone@hsc.utah.edu]
URL of comment: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Widget+Connector+Macro?focusedCommentId=223221342#comment-223221342
Quote:
{quote}
We are using the Widget macro to display password protected video from Vimeo.  This has just stopped working. We have upgraded to the newest version of Widget. Example (screenshot given).

This screen use to bring up the password prompt from Vimeo; however, now we just get a black screen of death.
Any suggestions would be helpful.
{quote}

*Comment 2:*
From: [brad mcgilligan|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/~brad.mcgilligan]
URL of comment: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Widget+Connector+Macro?focusedCommentId=312738192#comment-312738192
{quote}
Rich Schone Did you ever get a fix for this? I am trying to embed a vimeo video from my plus account but only allow embedding in my Confluence wiki - I have set the domain properly to mydomain.atlassian.net but I still get the Vimeo error message. 
{quote}


*Comment 3:*
From: [Will Millar|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/~willmillar]
URL of comment: 
{quote}
Rich Schone or brad mcgilligan — I'm looking to fix this as well. I am trying to sell my team on adopting Confluence, but this Vimeo issue is holding everything up! Anybody have any fixes or workarounds?

None of the Widget Connector macros (except for YouTube) will work on any computer I test on.
{quote}
fields.summary: Widget Connector does not work with password-protected videos on Vimeo

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms

When visiting a URL for an attachment that does not exist, the server returns a response that the browser cannot handle.

Specifically, the 404 response contains the "Content-Encoding: gzip" header, but the response body is not actually gzip-encoded. The browser fails to render the 404 page and instead renders its own error message complaining about bad encoding. This also appears to affect 500 responses.

This can be reproduced with Chrome, Safari and Firefox. See attactment for a screenshot from Firefox.

An example URL to trigger this is

http://localhost:8080/confluence/download/attachments/INVALIDNUMBER/43434/test.txt

It would appear that this only happens when going directly to Confluence. If a proxy server sits in between, it seems to massage the response to fix the inconsistent encoding.

h4. Workaround

Disable compression in Confluence:

# Browse > Confluence Admin > General Configuration
# Edit
# Uncheck "Compress HTTP Responses"
fields.summary: Invalid HTTP response when hitting a 4xx or 5xx error. So Not Permitted/500jsp will never be shown to user

fields.description:
You can see this behaviour if you:
- create a GET request from the editpage POST request
- put this URL into a link on any page
- click multiple times on the link

(see screenshot)

There is no security (at least on database level) that page versions must be unique.
fields.summary: Confluence saves pages with the same version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27334].
  {panel}

See also:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-6847

"edit .../" in the web app is _not_ a sensible solution IMO.

All that's really needed here is the ability to put some custom text instead (preferably including e.g. web links).

Given that any one using confluence seriously should have external user management I'm surprised that this isn't already the case.

thanks
fields.summary: When using user directories the "forgot password" page need customising

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27332].
  {panel}

It would be nice when managing the spaces to know who the users of this space are. At the moment when one logs into the permission page, one finds user groups without knowing the users belonging to it. You need to open another tab to find this information.

So, something like this would be convenient, and even more so if it could be filtered by user group (finding in which spaces the group is used) or by space:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0Aoac2O7ZIBewdGhBcnN4VVhZNWc1TWRPZDI3dk1zVnc&pli=1#gid=0

Or at least, at the space level, a link from the user group name to its list of users.
fields.summary: Overview of Users/Group/Space in one place

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27331].
  {panel}

As far as I understand/experienced:
- Clicking edit on a previous version of a page always sends you to the edit of the last version.
- As a consequence, there is no tool to view the "source" or thing to copy & paste a specific part of an older version.

So you are left with following options:
- by the look of a historical page, try to figure out how a person has created a block of content. Do a raw copy and re-do the layout by hand
- re-instate an older version, and do all the intermediate changes by hand again.

If this is all correct, I think it would be great to have an Read-Only mode for the SOURCE of older versions of a page, to allow easy copy pasting of specific parts into a newer version.
fields.summary: Merging content from different page versions

fields.description:
When modifying table data on a page, comparison view produces various problematic symptoms.

# *On the first screenshot you can see if there were two spaces delete before and after each cell that has new data entered in it.*
!pagecompare_1.png!
# *On the second screenshot the deleted value was shifted one column left.*
!pagecompare_2.png!
# *On the third screenshot you can see modifications that weren't made, the whole table was altered in the view.*
!pagecompare_3.png!



You can find the sample space export attached which contains the corresponding page and can check what changes were actually made.
fields.summary: Page comparison with tables render incorrectly
Unable to Install CCRC from India, Bangalore link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27328].
  {panel}

Connecting to WebDAV on OS X 10.8.x or Windows 7 will refuse authentication, although nothing is printed to the logs.

Connecting on an older version of OS X (tested 10.6.x) works without a problem.

Steps to reproduce on OS X:

# Open Finder
# Hit CMD + K to bring up the 'Connect to Server' dialog box
# Enter the URL http://<path-to-confluence>/plugins/servlet/confluence/default
# When prompted, enter your credentials

*On 10.8.x*

The Finder dialog box will shake and prompt for authentication again

*On 10.6.x*

Finder will open Confluence's page/attachment structure as expected

h2. Workaround

Third party clients such as [Cyberduck|http://cyberduck.ch] work correctly.
As an example, to connect to _http://localhost:8090/confluence_ you'd use these details:

!cyberduck.png!

Server = URL _before_ the port number
Port = port number
Path = URL _after_ the port number
fields.summary: Unable to connect with WebDav on OS X 10.8.x or Windows 7

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27327].
  {panel}

If I have a table (or a note/warning) directly followed by a heading
* previously I simply added a new line between them
* now placing the cursor in the table and pressing enter does create a new line - but in the table
* placing the cursor before the heading and pressing enter creates a new heading
** so i'll have to use the mouse to "undo" the heading - then start typing
fields.summary: Placing the cursor before the heading and pressing enter creates a new heading
Add a 'paste without formatting' button to the Editor Toolbar
Create the ability to set the target for a link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27322].
  {panel}

Old versions of pages should not get indexed by google (I'm thinking nofollow is the right meta tag). 

Pages like this:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=213521581

Are showing up in search:
https://www.google.com/search?sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8&q=site%3Aconfluence.atlassian.com+onpremise

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27320].
  {panel}

I was editing a page while the parent page was renamed. This made it impossible to save the page.

I tried to change the location of the page I was editing (to select a new/different parent), but I was unable.

It seems like if a parent page is renamed while a child page is being edited, the child page should automatically update to the new parent page name. Or if the parent is deleted while the child is being edited then the child would automatically be moved to the top level of the space (which already happens to child pages when you delete a parent page).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a parent page and a child page
# Edit the child page in one browser tab
# Remove the parent page in another tab
#- Observe that there is a warning that indicates the page will be move to the root of the space
# Attempt to save the child page
#- Observe the error in the attached screenshot
# Expected behaviour - the page can be saved and is moved to the root of the space, as indicated by the warning when deleting the parent page

h3. Workaround
# Create a new page under a parent that still exists
# Copy the contents of the page into that page and Save
fields.summary: while editing a page, renaming parent page makes it impossible to save edited page
Bulk add users to a group - add more than 10 users at time

fields.description:
My users use excel macro heavily for reporting in Confluence. And they usually use Pivot Chart to show statuses.

In some cases, when the axis texts get too long, they change the axis texts to display vertically, instead of the normal horizontal display. 

To reproduce this:
# Create a page in Confluence.
# Attach the excel file, [^Defect.xlsx]
# Use office excel macro to display the excel file.
# After preview/save, it shows as 
!ViewPage.png|thumbnail!
# But when you open the excel file in Office 2010, it shows 
!ExcelView.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Excel Macro does not render Pivot Chart's axis text correctly
Ability to sort watches list
Add a context menu for tables in the editor

fields.description:
As per customers screenshots, they were leaving breaks between list items which showed fine in the editor but were removed when previewing or viewing the saved page in Firefox.

I wasn't able to reproduce so have asked for more details on the exact steps when creating the list.

----
*Steps to Replicate*:

# Create a numbered list.
# Use Shift+Enter to add additional line spacing between numbered list.
# Preview or Save file, or View Source of page and apply.

*Expected Results*:

Line spacing is retained.

*Actual Results*:

Line spacing is randomly removed. The issue can be very intermittent.
fields.summary: Line breaks in list removed on preview/save

fields.description:
The message, as well as a link to the adobe website from which you can install Flash is still displayed after Flash is installed, underneath the pdf that is being rendered by the viewpdf macro.

The following is a screenshot given to us by a client experiencing the problem.

!viewer.png!

A possible reason for it can be that The flash plugin has a different name (_Shockwave Flash Object_) in IE9 than it does in Firefox (_Shockwave Flash_).

I initially came about this issue when a customer shared it with me on Twitter (they are using Confluence 3.5):

https://twitter.com/shweta_hardikar/status/270750196714045441

chrome does not display confluence main menu

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27300].
  {panel}

h5. Scenario:
Sharing a page with multiple users always returns an "Error while sending" message:
!1.JPG!

While sharing a page with a single user is not an issue as it returns the expected result which is "Sent"

However, Confluence sends all of the notifications without any problems (there is no queued messages, all users get their notifications). Nevertheless, this is a problem because this error is misleading and when users see this error message, they think their shared pages won't get through so they try to send it out again and again and this became a spam.

h5. Resolution
This issue has been fixed in version 1.26.1 of the Share Page plugin. This is compatible for Confluence 4.3 and above. You can update the plugin by going to Manage Add-ons in Confluence Admin. If the update is compatible with your version of Confluence, it will be displayed in Action Required.
fields.summary: Confluence always displays "Error While Sending" message when sharing a page with multiple users, although the notifications are sent without problem

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27299].
  {panel}

With CONF-6445 context around diff was shrunk to minimal and it is not configurable how much context is shown. 

This causes problems when Confluence is used to manage constantly changing content where changes need to be tracked. For example user stories or specification changes are sent to development as version diff links so that further analysis and page edits will not interfere with development. Currently only small amount of content is displayed and user cannot even see to what paragraph (under which heading) it belongs to.

CONF-6445 suggested that amount of context could be configurable (In 4.3.2 I did not find the option) - that would be really good solution. 
Another option would be to add a link that would show full page with diffs (it could be extra selection under view button for example).
fields.summary: Visual page diff tool: Make context size configurable

fields.summary: Boosting of user results in Confluence search is far too high and always renders incorrect results

fields.description:
Error rendering macro 'contentbylabel' : com.atlassian.confluence.macro.params.ParameterException: '"><script>(alert(12345)</script>' is not an existing space's key

That is the error message displayed. Exception should not be shown on screen

Steps to reproduce:
1. Add the ContentbyLabel macro.
2. In the Edit Macro window, enter any invalid value as the value of Restricted to Spaces box.
3. Save the macro
fields.summary: Exception Message shown on screen when invalid space key added to "ContentByLabel" Macro
Support for MOU Markup

fields.description:
While in edit mode using Google Chrome, if a page contains a HTML macro with HTML form markup inside, clicking "Cancel" or "Save" will result in a blank screen. This is tested in Google Chrome (Google Chrome version 19 and 23 tested). h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a page and enter this HTML form {code}
Name:
Email Address:
{code} # Attempt to Save the page #- Expected behaviour - the page saves and the form is visible #- Actual behaviour - the browser redirects to 'about:blank' NB: The page is actually saved. You can go to the Dashboard and find the page, and the form is visible and correct h3. Workaround # Follow the steps above, then go to the Dashboard or the parent page after the blank page is displayed # You will see the page is in the recent updates (or listed in the child pages of the parent page), and it works correctly
fields.summary: HTML Form Markup Breaks Edit Mode Cancel and Save Button Functionality in Google Chrome

fields.description:
If using the Global Look and Feel theme in Confluence 4.3.2, the Insert Macro Browser and Gliffy Diagram actions fail to popup from the Insert menu in edit mode. HOWEVER, choosing "Add" "Gliffy Diagram" when in view mode on the page does work. For example:

TO REPRODUCE THIS ERROR:

1. Configure a Confluence space to use the default global look and feel theme.
2. Add or edit a page using Google Chrome (version 19 and 23 tested), and while in edit mode, choose "Insert" then "Other Macros".
3. Notice that nothing happens; no pop-up window appears. The same can be said for inserting a Gliffy Diagram unless you add one from "View" mode.
fields.summary: Edit Mode Insert Menu Fails in Google Chrome using the Global Look and Feel Default Theme

fields.description:
If you access any non existing page receiving the 404 page, that page requests the CSS file {{<confluence_url>/includes/css/setup.css}} which cannot be found in that location.

There is a file with the same name in {{<confluence_url>/setup/includes/css/setup.css}}. This is the location for that file since Confluence 4.0.
fields.summary: 404 error use non existant css

fields.description:
We tried an confluence upgrade from 4.2.1 to 4.3.3.

That was ok, but we could not connect to the plugin exchange server.

So we tried to update the Plugin Manager to version 2.7.8

We got the message:

This version of Confluence is unknown to the plugin information server. It may be too new to appear, or it may be some type of non-standard build. No plugins can be found for unknown product versions. 

After that, the plugins link disappeared.

We discovered, that the standalone version has the build number 3393.

The offcial build number seams to be 3392.
fields.summary: Wrong build number for standalone Version 4.3.3
Add ToolTip option for links through editing UI

fields.description:
h3. Summary of The Bug

{{Viewpdf}} macro does not encode and convert the filename character to URL encoded resulting to "*Page Not Found*" error as Confluence unable to fetch the PDF file

h3. How to Reproduce The Bug

# Upload PDF attachment with a filename that include special character such as #,%
!pdfattachment.png|thumbnail!
# View the PDF attachment using {{viewfile}} macro
# Try to download the page using the "downward arrow on the bottom left of the macro"
# {{viewpdf}} macro does not encode and convert the filename to URL correctly as seen on the screenshot below
#* Wrong URL
!wrongurl.png!
#* Correct URL
!correctURL.png!
# Because of the incorrectly converted URL, Confluence redirect it to "Page Not Found" error
!error.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Downloading from the attachment list or the attachment menu work fine
fields.summary: viewpdf does not convert the download URL correctly

fields.description:
This item is believed to be used to track the position of the last inline task added in edit mode.

When the draft is saved, this item is not deleted and still reference a non-existent ContentEntityObject. A site backup will find many of these orphaned items.

This could interfere with a space restore as it may reference an unintended ContentEntityObject by accident after id remapping.
fields.summary: BucketPropertySetItem keyed "confluence.inline.tasks.sequence.last" is not deleted after the draft is saved.
New left hand nav thingy overlays page content when printing

fields.summary: Export to PDF omits some unicode characters

fields.description:
h5. Issue
Newly installed add-ons that use AJS.bind('init.rte', func...) (instead of the old AJS.toInit method) don't work on Confluence 4.3.x.

This has been reproducible for example with the Gliffy add-on, with the Confluence Source Editor and with a custom alert JavaScript.

h5. Gliffy
The installed Gliffy version 4.5.7 on our production system runs fine.

However, on our cloned development machine, when I uninstall Gliffy 4.5.7 and reinstall the same Gliffy version 4.5.7, Gliffy is not launched when I try to insert a Gliffy macro - instead the standard Confluence macro dialog appears (see attached screenshot). Of course, uninstalling Gliffy 4.5.7 and installing Gliffy 5.0 doesn't work, too (this has initially alerted me of this issue).

I've been in contact with the Gliffy Support Desk (#34009). 
They have confirmed the issue: A custom built Gliffy snapshot that uses AJS.toInit() instead of AJS.bind('init.rte', func...) does launch the Gliffy dialog on our development machine. The Gliffy developer has asked me to open a ticket with Atlassian.

h5. Custom JavaScript
On the same note, when I add JavaScript via custom HTML to the head 

{code}
 <script type="text/javascript">
(function($) {
AJS.toInit(function() {
$('#notifyWatchers').attr('checked', false);
alert('Test!');
...
{code}

does work but

{code}
...
(function($) {
AJS.bind('init.rte', function() {
...
{code}

does not (not unchecking the checkbox or even raising the alert box).

This affects all current browsers: Firefox 16, IE 9, Chrome 23

h5. Other add-ons affected
These add-ons that most likely use the bind method don't work, too:

- Confluence Source Editor 1.0.6: The <> icon doesn't even show up in the editor
- Confluence Quick Comments Plug-in: "Error loading the comment editor. Timeout while waiting for the editor resources to load"

h5. Not working solutions
These steps did not help:

- Making sure that with the add-ons affected all modules are enabled
- Clearing the plug-ins cache as described in https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+Clear+Confluence+Plugins+Cache
- Enabling safe mode and only re-enabling one affected custom plug-in at a time: Gliffy 4.5.7; Gliffy 5.0 or the Confluence Source Editor.


Best regards,
Frank
fields.summary: Newly installed add-ons that use AJS.bind('init.rte') don't work
Some macro CSS is not included when loading Dashboard or Site Welcome Message
Remove 'Attach Files to User Profile' From Permissions Pages
